answers.answer: I think mostly the dr. will go by your LMP unless you are drastically different from that to the u/s.  Mine was only 4 days off so we are sticking with my LMP.  I would say go by your LMP unless your dr. tells you otherwise.Good luck!!
I would go with LMP.  You are falling with in the two weeks regardless, so the little one will come when full baked ;).  I wish you the best of luck.

My Dr.'s office insists on going by the LMP, not the O date, or known date of conception. They will only change the EDD if you measure more than a week off. So they have me 3 days ahead of myself. I know my due date is 1/25, based on a conception date of 5/4,  and they say 1/22, based on LMP od 4/18. It doesn't realy matter much though, as long as I know.

the farther along you are the less accurate the u/s are, at least that is what my dr. tells me.  i have gestational diabetes, and did with my previous preg.  i had numberous u/s to monitor baby and they never changed the EDD.  they told me the one they had done when i was 11wks was the most accurate.  my ds measured early with each subsequent u/s, measuring almost 2wks early at the last u/s.i had an u/s at 8wks where they gave me the EDD of 11/11 (i had no idea when my last af was so they did it to date the preg).  well, i had an u/s a week ago at 26wks and my EDD was measuring 11/10.  but it was a very indepth u/s that took quite some time and they looked at EVERYTHING.  however, they told me they would stick with the 8wk u/s as it was the most accurate.  the dr said as the baby gets larger they cannot measure her at one view, so they have to measure the head, femur, and abd to estimate.
